newsitem.title: FRANCE: Fish shipments lift Brest air cargo traffic 22.6pc.
newsitem.headline: Fish shipments lift Brest air cargo traffic 22.6pc.

text.p: Brest's Guipavas airport said it handled 2,103 tonnes of global cargo traffic in the first eight months of 1996, an increase of 22.6 percent on the same period last year.

One of the main factors in traffic growth has been the buoyant demand for fish and seafood exports from Brittany to Paris, the south of France and Corsica, an airline official at Brest Airport told Reuters.
January-August 1996 postal traffic handled at Brest Airport was up 2.5 percent on the first eight months of last year at 1,297 tonnes, the airport authority said.

French airline, L'Aeropostale, carries overnight mail between its Paris-Charles-de-Gaulle hub and Brest on a regular basis using a five-tonne capacity Fokker 27 aircraft. - Air Cargo Newsroom Tel+44 171 542 7706 Fax+44 171 542 5017
